issues.description: Method name/signature inconsistency for the meal-cost calculation: the problem statement UML and text refer to a static method calculateTotalPrice(Meal): int, but the template and solution repositories disagree about the name. The template's Main uses computeMealCost(...), the solution's SealSaloon implements computeMealCost(...), while the solution's Main calls calculateTotalPrice(...). This mismatch (different method names used across problem statement, template, and solution) is structural and will confuse students which method to implement and which name tests/main expect. It also causes the provided solution to be internally inconsistent (Main calls a method that SealSaloon does not provide).
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the method name/signature across all artifacts. Either: (A) Rename computeMealCost to calculateTotalPrice in SealSaloon and update any Main or template references to call static int calculateTotalPrice(Meal), matching the problem statement; or (B) Update the problem statement (and UML) to require computeMealCost instead of calculateTotalPrice. Ensure the method is static and returns an int as specified, and update all example usages in Main and template comments so the repository is internally consistent.

issues.description: The problem statement (UML and textual requirements) refers to a SealSaloon static method named calculateTotalPrice(Meal): int, but both the template/solution code use the identifier computeMealCost(Meal) for the same functionality. This mismatch between the expected method name in the exercise description and the actual method name in the codebase can confuse students: they may look for calculateTotalPrice to implement or call, while the provided Main and the solution implement/expect computeMealCost. The concept (computing the total price/cost of a Meal) is the same, but the differing identifiers create an unnecessary mapping burden.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the naming consistent across artifacts. Either (A) rename the method computeMealCost(Meal) in the template and solution to calculateTotalPrice(Meal) (and update all calls, e.g., in Main), or (B) update the problem statement and UML to refer to computeMealCost(Meal). Ensure the chosen name is static and returns an int as specified in the problem description to preserve the intended API and pedagogical requirements.
